description: Learn React concepts and build modern user interfaces with this popular JavaScript library.

lessons.title: Introduction to React
lessons.content: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. Learn what React is and why it's so popular.

lessons.title: Components and Props
lessons.content: Components let you split the UI into independent, reusable pieces. Props are how components communicate.

lessons.title: State and Events
lessons.content: State is how React components manage data that can change over time. Events allow components to respond to user interactions.

lessons.title: Conditional Rendering
lessons.content: Conditional rendering allows you to display different components or elements based on certain conditions.

lessons.title: Lists and Keys
lessons.content: React allows you to transform arrays into lists of elements using the map() function.

lessons.title: Simple JSX Examples
lessons.content: JSX is a syntax extension for JavaScript that looks similar to HTML. It allows you to write HTML-like code in your JavaScript files.

lessons.title: Virtual DOM Explanation
lessons.content: The Virtual DOM is a programming concept where a virtual representation of the UI is kept in memory and synced with the real DOM.

lessons.title: Mini Project: Counter App
lessons.content: Build a complete counter application using React concepts you've learned.

lessons.title: Component Reuse and Props Drilling
lessons.content: Learn how to create reusable components and understand the challenges of props drilling in component hierarchies.

lessons.title: useState, useEffect (concept only)
lessons.content: Deep dive into React hooks for state management and side effects in functional components.

lessons.title: Event Handling
lessons.content: Handle user interactions and events in React components with proper event handling patterns.

lessons.title: Conditional Rendering
lessons.content: Implement advanced conditional rendering techniques for dynamic UIs.

lessons.title: Props vs State (explained visually)
lessons.content: Understand the key differences between props and state with visual examples and use cases.

lessons.title: JSX Expressions
lessons.content: Master JSX expressions for dynamic content rendering and complex UI logic.

lessons.title: Mini Project: React-like Counter Concept Demo (using Vanilla JS)
lessons.content: Create a React-like counter component using vanilla JavaScript to understand React concepts.

questions.question: What is React?
options: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces

options: A JavaScript extension that allows HTML-like syntax
